title: CLNet: Complex Input Lightweight Neural Network designed for Massive MIMO CSI Feedback

mathematical_framework.system_model: y = Ax + z, A = diag{h₁ᴴp₁, ..., h_Ncᴴp_Nc}
mathematical_framework.optimization_objective: {Θ̂_E, Θ̂_D} = arg min_{Θ_E,Θ_D} ||H_a - f_D(f_E(H_a, Θ_E), Θ_D)||²₂

breakthrough_achievements.paradigm_shift: First complex-input lightweight neural network for massive MIMO
breakthrough_achievements.complex_processing_innovation: Forged complex-valued input layer preserving phase information
breakthrough_achievements.attention_mechanism_fusion: Dual attention (SE + CBAM) for channel and spatial focus
breakthrough_achievements.encoder_decoder_balance: Enhanced encoder with lightweight decoder architecture

forged_complex_input_layer.technical_details: 1x1 pointwise convolution preserving complex signal structure
forged_complex_input_layer.advantage: Maintains amplitude and phase information without mixing CSI elements

attention_based_encoder.dual_attention: SE block for channel attention + CBAM for spatial attention
attention_based_encoder.focus_mechanism: Emphasizes significant propagation paths in angle-delay domain
attention_based_encoder.computational_efficiency: Selective feature enhancement with minimal overhead

hard_sigmoid_optimization.mathematical_comparison: Traditional: σ(x) = 1/(1 + e^(-x)), Hard: hσ(x) = min(max(x + 3, 0), 6)/6

encoder_decoder_architecture.parameter_efficiency: Reduced parameters while maintaining reconstruction quality

dfhar_integration_value.section_2_methodology: Complex signal processing techniques for WiFi CSI
dfhar_integration_value.section_3_technical_foundations: Attention mechanisms for CSI feature enhancement
dfhar_integration_value.section_4_experimental_validation: Lightweight network design for edge deployment

editorial_appeal.mimo_relevance: Fundamental contribution to massive MIMO CSI feedback

complex_csi_processing_relevance.rationale: WiFi CSI signals are complex-valued, CLNet's forged complex input layer directly applicable
complex_csi_processing_relevance.adaptation_potential: 1×1 convolution approach preserves WiFi CSI phase and amplitude relationships

lightweight_design_relevance.rationale: Edge deployment critical for real-time HAR applications
lightweight_design_relevance.adaptation_potential: Computational efficiency techniques directly transferable to WiFi sensing

attention_mechanism_relevance.rationale: Spatial attention applicable to CSI spatial-temporal feature extraction
attention_mechanism_relevance.adaptation_potential: CBAM mechanism can focus on behavior-relevant CSI features

activation_optimization_relevance.rationale: Hard Sigmoid improves edge device inference efficiency
activation_optimization_relevance.adaptation_potential: Hardware-friendly activation functions enhance HAR system deployment

technical_limitations.scope_specificity: Designed specifically for massive MIMO FDD systems
technical_limitations.complex_processing_challenge: Still requires optimization for full complex neural networks
technical_limitations.hardware_adaptation: Hard Sigmoid may introduce quantization losses
technical_limitations.generalization_validation: Limited evaluation across different channel models
technical_limitations.computational_complexity: While reduced, still requires significant computational resources

future_research_directions: Extension to WiFi CSI processing with complex input preservation
Integration with WiFi-based human activity recognition systems
Optimization for ultra-lightweight edge deployment in IoT devices
Fusion of attention mechanisms with temporal sequence modeling
Development of fully complex neural network architectures
Cross-domain adaptation from MIMO to WiFi sensing applications
mathematical_equations: System Model: y = Ax + z, where A = diag{h₁ᴴp₁, ..., h_Ncᴴp_Nc}
CSI Transformation: H' = F_c H F_t^H
Optimization Objective: {Θ̂_E, Θ̂_D} = arg min_{Θ_E,Θ_D} ||H_a - f_D(f_E(H_a, Θ_E), Θ_D)||²₂
SE Block: s = F_ex(z, W) = σ(W₂δ(W₁z)), Ĩ:,:,i = s_i I:,:,i

institutional_details.institution: School of Computer Science and Engineering, Nanyang Technological University
institutional_details.funding: Singapore MOE Tier 2 under grant T2EP20220-0011

comprehensive_quality_assessment.recommendation_level: Highly Recommended - Foundational contribution to lightweight complex neural networks
